column4: does anyone have any idea why Grub would be failing to boot Ubuntu when the settings all look right? :S
they may look ok, but perhaps they're still wrong?

sounds like solid theory. But it sometimes also throws in the cd player, mixes up partitions, and also note that hdb5 is an extended partition which may also screw things up. I suggest you get the supergrub disc and fix grub with that.
they are all multilanguage, so you can just switch languages. It should have -en with it at least.
